results.title: The Count-down under
results.creator_credit: Ramakantha Sarma, Frank Jacoby and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Examines the oceans of the world and their promise for man’s survival, against the background of the population explosion, the dwindling food supply and constant depletion of natural resources. The Indian Ocean as a source of food; new fishing methods off the coast of Delaware; mineral resources of the sea; and Sea Lab I, an experiment in living beneath the sea.

results.title: The Counselling approach
results.creator_credit: Phil Swerdlow and Concord Films Council
results.brief_description: Counselling plays an important part in helping a pregnant woman face an abortion. There is a need for the woman to discuss her reactions to the situation and the decisions she makes concerning this. The work of counsellors in this area is highlighted.

results.title: The Coulomb force constant
results.creator_credit: Richard Leacock and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description: Eric M. Rogers shows a large scale version of the Millikan experiment by which the value of the Coulomb force constant can be determined. Shows a large scale version of the Millikan experiment. The small charged plates of the original experiment are made very large and the effects are show of increasing plate area and separation and adding more batteries to charge the plates. The same electric field strength used in the Millikan experiment enables the experimenter to count the number of elementary charges on an object and measure the constant in Coulomb’s law of electric forces.

results.title: Could it happen here?
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Ron Marton and R. Crawford
results.brief_description: A short film made by the pupils of the North Sydney Boys’ High School, showing the school as a prison camp with the pupils as regimental inmates. Subtitled “The Great Escape”, it tells the story of the planning and execution of an escape. Prize-winner at the 1970 Sydney Film Festival.

results.title: Cough and you'll deafen thousands
results.brief_description: Offered as a tribute to the thousands of British broadcasting engineers whose initiative, inventiveness and skill have enabled British radio and television to achieve its present position, this film traces the growth of broadcasting from the first experiments in a hut at Writtle, Essex, to the coverage of the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. Told by the men who were actually involved, the story is both amusing and informative.

results.title: The Cuckoo = Le Coucou
results.creator_credit: Francois Bel, Gerard Vienne and Les Cineastes Animaliers Associes
results.brief_description: A study of the parasitic reproduction of the cuckoo. The cuckoo does not build itself a nest, but lays its eggs in other bird’s nests and leaves them to hatch and rear its young. However, there are hazards associated with parasitic reproduction; barely ten percent of young cuckoos attain their full growth. Uses natural sound only.

results.title: The Cottonseed
results.brief_description: Set in the northern plains of Nigeria the film shows the main stages in the growth of cotton, and gives a glimpse of the cotton ginning process, before ending with an account of the uses of the oilseed crop.

results.title: Cotton: from fiber to fabric
results.brief_description: Illustrates the partnership of science and nature in producing today’s version of the fibre which has served the human race for 5,000 years. Time-lapse photography shows the cotton plants emerging from the ground, growing, flowering and growing fruit. Animated drawings show the cellular development and structure of the cotton fibre. The wonders of the laboratory are shown where new finishes make modern cottons crease and wrinkle resistant, easier to care for, waterproof and stainproof.

results.title: Cotton
results.brief_description: Shows hand and machine picking of cotton in the United States, followed by extraction of seeds by gin. Also explains how the cotton is baled, cleaned, fluffed, carded, spun into yarn, and finally woven into cloth.
results.description: Shows hand and machine picking of cotton in the United States, followed by extraction of seeds by gin. Also explains how the cotton is baled, cleaned, fluffed, carded, spun into yarn, and finally woven into cloth.

results.title: A Cottage on Dartmoor
results.creator_credit: Anthony Asquith and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Released with a synchronised music disc in 1930, but essentially regarded as a silent film. Anthony Asquith last ‘silent’ film was considered a rival to Hitchcock’s ‘Blackmail’. Presents the unrequited love of a barber’s assistant for a manicurist and the results of his jealous rage when she becomes engaged to a customer, relayed in a long flash-back during his attempted escape from Dartmoor. Cast includes: Norah Baring, Uno Henning, Hans Schlettow and Judd Green. Photographed by Stanley Rodwell. Story by Herbert C. Price.
